- Week 11: W 26-9 → 26 points
- Week 12: W 23-17 → 23 points
- Week 13: W 30-10 → 30 points
- Week 14: L 10-34 → Lost, but scored only 10

So the highest score by the Colts in a single game is indeed 49 points against the Atlanta Falcons on November 12, 1967. That's in row index 8.

I should also note that there are no other games where the Colts scored more than 49 points, so this is the maximum.
</think>

The claim is TRUE as the Colts scored 49 points in week 9.

Wait a second, in Week 4, the opponent (Chicago Bears) scored exactly 3 points. That seems to be the lowest score by any team in these games. But I should check all other games to make sure there isn't a lower score somewhere else.

Looking back:

- The earliest weeks show higher scores except for Week 4 and Week 14, where opponents had 3 and 34 points respectively.

I don't see any game where a team scored fewer than 3 points. So the lowest was exactly 3 in Week 4.

Wait, no—rows are zero-indexed. Let me confirm:
